skills.name: reMIDI
eBook
skills.page:
<p>
Time to enter the wonderful world of eBook creation! Go to project
Gutenberg (or some other similar source) and choose a (short!) book
you like, in plain text. Your task, then, is to produce an ePub
version of that book. You should include a few images or illustrations
wherever you find relevant (for instance, at the beginning of each
chapter), a table of contents and a cover. Also, you should take
special care with text reflow, etc. For instance, typically the text
version of the book will have line breaks that you'll need to remove
for the text to reflow properly. You'll probably find <a href="http://code.google.com/p/sigil/">Sigil</a> and
<a href="http://calibre-ebook.com/">Calibre</a> of use, for this...
</p>


<p>
Post the original text (with a link to the source) and the ePub, plus
a short description of the changes you made. You should present
original work, and we may ask for improvements/changes before
accepting the result, especially if the quality or originality
requirements aren't met.
</p>

skills.name: Course Logo
Zombies and Monsters
Alien Invasion
Reporter
Text Art
3D GIF
Podcast
skills.page:
<p>
The idea is for you to create a podcast episode. A podcast, in case
you aren't familiarized with the concept, is an audio show distributed
online, usually on a regular basis. There are podcasts of the most
varied types you can imagine, from a single guy ranting about a
subject to panel discussions to authors reading books. They often
include theme songs, separators and audio special effects. Think of
them as modern day radio shows.
</p>

<p>
You can tackle this task in two different ways:
<dl>
<dt style="font-weight:bold;">A short story podcast: </dt><dd>many
  authors read their stories online in podcast format, a chapter a
  week
  (ex: <a href="http://www.podiobooks.com">Podiobooks</a>). Choose a
  short story of your liking and record an episode where you read and
  dramatize it. What's expected? A theme song, author intro before
  starting the story (telling us about what is going to be read),
  closing music, different voices for different characters and special
  effects where relevant. For instance, if you read about a gun being
  fired, it would be nice to hear the bang in the background (just
  make sure it doesn't interfere with the understanding of the
  narration).</dd>
</dl>
<dt style="font-weight:bold;">Show on a subject of your
  interest</dt><dd>Like scifi movies? Then make a show about
  that. Comment on comic books. Discuss the latest android apps in the
  market. Etc. The format is similar to that for a short story (intro,
  effects, etc.) but you'll have to script it yourself instead of just
  reading someone's tale aloud.
</dd>
</dl>

</p>
We expect something of around 3-5 min in length. You should attach to
your post the resulting mp3 file and the script (either written by you or
the short story you read). In the post include a short description of
what you did. And, you know it: present original work, and we may ask for
  improvements/changes before accepting the result, especially if the
  quality or originality requirements aren't met.
</p>

skills.name: Course Image
Publicist
reTrailer
Movie Poster
Living Page
skills.page:
<p>
Dead-tree books are sooooo eighteenth century... Today, we're moving
towards ebooks! And even current ebooks aren't all that great. You
see, they try to mimic their dead tree counterparts with static pages
full of text. We can do better.
</p>

<p>
In particular, there is this notion of interactive books or reactive
documents, where we can interact with the page. The goal is to augment
the reading experience to make materials easier to understand. This
has huge implications for teaching, for instance.  The idea is that
instead of just reading an equation on paper, you can change its
values and see the result right there in real time. If you manipulate
a graph, you get to see the text changing to refer the values you've
just changed.
</p>
<p>Former Apple designer Bret Victor has been playing with these ideas
  for a while. He created Tangle, a javascript library to do this on
  the browser. Check it out at his
  site, <a href="http://worrydream.com/#!/Tangle">Worry Dream</a>, as
  well as some other examples in
  his <a href="http://worrydream.com/ExplorableExplanations/">Explorable
  Explanations</a> and <a href="http://worrydream.com/KillMath/">Kill
  Math</a> pages.
</p>

<p>
Your goal here is to choose a suitable technical subject of your
liking and create a reactive document to explain it. Your document
must contain not only reactive text but also graphs, figures or
diagrams. You can use Tangle or whatever else you like, as long as the
result is similar.
</p>

<p> Post a description of the subject you're tackling and the design
process of the document. Attach a zip with a self-contained document
(i.e., include all files needed to make it work). Be original and, as
always, we may ask for improvements/changes before accepting the
result, especially if the quality or originality requirements aren't
met.
</ul>

skills.name: Looping GIF
Movie Barcodes
Fake Speech
skills.page:
<p>
The same politician often gives plenty of speeches, interviews,
etc. It is time to do what they themselves have done for a long time:
take things out of context and make them say something different than
what they wanted to say. Take a look at the movie clip below:
</p>




<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kT2rjB1pU9E?list=PL0HEi-tuGk_QSzxakWp0O3o_lf0dIWW7G" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>


<p>
It shows news, not a speech, but the idea is the same. Can you get the
Prime Minister to promise to lower taxes? Can you get the President to
ask for pizza? Go for it (do be tasteful, though!) To get this done
you'll need to locate multiple clips of the same person speaking. If
you can get them speaking in the same place all the better (Marcelo
Rebelo de Sousa anyone?). Then write the script of what you wish them
to appear to be saying and scan the videos for the correct words or
excerpts. Then it is up to your video editing skills!
</p>



<p>Post a description of the techniques and tools you used to create
  the video, the script and, of course, the resulting video (45-60sec). You
  should try, as much as possible, to keep jumps in sound
  unnoticeable. Don't cut word endings, etc. Be original, tasteful,
  and, as always, we may ask for improvements/changes before accepting
  the result, especially if the quality or originality requirements
  aren't met.
</ul>

skills.name: Fake News
skills.page:
<p>
News shows often have a recurrent anchorman or woman, reading the news
day after day. This creates a wealth of speech that we can use for our
amusement (and this task). Let's take things out of context (as people
on TV often do, to push their own points...) and make them say
something different than what they wanted to say. Take a look at the
movie clip below:
</p>

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kT2rjB1pU9E?list=PL0HEi-tuGk_QSzxakWp0O3o_lf0dIWW7G" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

<p>
Can you get José Rodrigues dos Santos to announce the sale of Colombo
to the chinese? José Alberto Carvalho to report on the new
garbage-powered rocket for everyday travel? Go for it (do be tasteful,
though!) To get this done you'll need to locate multiple clips of the
same person speaking. If you can get them speaking in the same set all
the better (should be easy for news anchors?). Then write the script
of what you wish them to appear to be saying and scan the videos for
the correct words or excerpts. Then it is up to your video editing
skills!
</p>



<p>Post a description of the techniques and tools you used to create
  the video, the script and, of course, the resulting video (45-60sec). You
  should try, as much as possible, to keep jumps in sound
  unnoticeable. Don't cut word endings, etc. Be original, tasteful,
  and, as always, we may ask for improvements/changes before accepting
  the result, especially if the quality or originality requirements
  aren't met.
</ul>

skills.name: Cartoonist
Kinectic
Illuminator
Stop Motion
skills.page:
<p>
<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stop_motion">Stop Motion</a> is
an animation technique that consists in taking a series of still
photos, where the characters/background are physically manipulated to
appear to move on their own. Changes between consecutive frames are
small and incremental, and are then played back as a continuous
sequence. South Park and Wallace and Gromit are two notable examples,
but people have been doing this with all sorts of characters. LEGO,
even:

</p>


</p>

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EhLEBCBGkmk" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>


<p>
So write or choose a story, find some dolls, action figures or
cardboard cutouts to be your characters, and shoot a Stop Motion film
(there are a number of smartphone apps that can help you, if you go
that way). Something around 1-2min will suffice, as long as it tells a
coherent story. We expect it to have voices, sound effects, some sort
of soundtrack and an opening and ending. Post a description of the
techniques and tools you used to create the video, the script and, of
course, the resulting video (or a link to it on youtube). Be original,
tasteful, and, as always, we may ask for improvements/changes before
accepting the result, especially if the quality or originality
requirements aren't met.
</p>

</ul>

levelsInfo.title: Headache
levelsInfo.page: Your head hurts. Really bad. Opening your eyes may not be the wisest course of action, but you feel you must. After all, who knows what you will see? Strolling home after a day's work you didn't see them come. You did feel the bang to the head and being dragged away and placed into a car (truck?) before passing out. "Well", you think, "at least I'm still alive...". You open your eyes.

levelsInfo.title: Cellar
levelsInfo.page:
You appear to be in some sort of cellar. You would call it a dungeon, except you are not in one of those games you used to play... So it must be a cellar... Yup, that's it, cellar! You're sure those chains attached to the walls have a perfectly good use for holding wine bottles or something. It is damp in here, and there is a door in one of the walls. And a piece of paper, next to you! Your head still hurts, but you pick up the paper. Scribbled in a quite decorative script, several lines of text run the length of the page: "My friend, I managed to smuggle this into your cell. There is still hope! They have taken you to awaken the beast, but I do not want to see it run rampant and destroy the world, as they do, the fools! They have unwittingly brought me the key to their undoing: your blood can open the gate, but it also means you are the one that can close it for good! I'll try to help you on your way! Go to the Library and seek information on how to get it done! You'll need this for the door:" 

69 . 1 x 1 + 1 = 1 : 19 . 1 x 1 + 1 = 1 : 47 .
67 . 1 z 1 ` 4 . 1 ^ 1 % 15 . 1 z 1 ` 4 . 1 ^ 1 % 45 .
7 . 1 u 6 . 1 d 2 ` 23 . 1 u 5 . 1 u 27 . 1 < 1 k 21 . 1 < 1 k 28 . 1 : 15 .

Hmm... looks like some kind of encoded message!

levelsInfo.title: The Corridor
levelsInfo.page:
You utter the words, and the door opens before you! The damp corridor stretches forward, and insersects with other no less damp, but much darker, passageways. It seems your path has been chosen for you... You turn left, then right, until you reach some stairs. "Up is good", you think! Before you go up, you decide to think carefully about what to do once you are out of the dung.. ahem... cellar! Everything appears silent, but you still manage to find some inspiration!

the_way.wav

levelsInfo.title: Hall
levelsInfo.page: At the top of the stairs there is a hall and, you think, surely your benefactor would not have let you without some assistence. There must be a clue somewhere! sure enough, under a dirty pot of plants you find another page. Is there a message among the noise? Something seems wrong with all the colors. And maybe it is just ten times too too dark to see?

levelsInfo.title: Owl
levelsInfo.page: "Owl"? What could that mean? But, it soon becomes apparent, as you hear a hown hooting in the distance! You decide to follow the sound. Maybe it lives by the library? You turn left, then right, along gloomy corridors. Soon you reach a door behwind which the owl certainly lies. Locked, of course! But, somewhat unsurprisingly, under another potted plant you find yet another clue. This time, a picture. Another owl! Hmm... the combination for this lock is not "owl"... There must be something else hidden in or next to the image...

levelsInfo.title: In the Library
levelsInfo.page: Inside the library tows upon rows of books await you. In the corner, the owl hoots depressingly. On a pedestal, a book lays open. You take a look and get acquainted with what awaits you. You've fallen into the clutches of a doomsday cult. They want to summon the Old Destroyer back to this plane of existence. If they manage to do so, the world will end, for mankind at least! You must stop this! You reach a page where the text says the solution to this problem lies. It is a very significant finding, but it appears the scribe did not give it the importance it deserves!

levelsInfo.title: Ring!
levelsInfo.page:
A dagger! The Dagger of Banishment, to be more precise! According to the text, it is the only thing capable of slaying the Old Destroyer and seal the portal to its foul dimension! Now you just have to find it. A small tuning fork accompanies the book. It is ornate... magical? It produces a vibrant, energetic sound! You ring it next to your ear in search of clues...

ring.mp3

levelsInfo.title: Vault
levelsInfo.page: You now know which room to find! You go towards the treasure vault, then. Suddenly, you hear noises! You turn a corner just in time! Two hooded figures pass you by, talking in a language you do not understand. One of them drops a paper! You pick it up. Again some type of code! What is it with these people? They cannot think straight?!

levelsInfo.title: The Vault, at Last!
levelsInfo.page: Blood is important, somehow... Better keep an eye open for it! Meanwhile, you have reached the vault door. Which, as one would expect, is locked! But by now you know the drill! Looking for a potted plant, you reach for the next note from your benefactor. Countless dots of color are probably hiding the combination!

levelsInfo.title: In the Vault!
levelsInfo.page:
The combination works! You enter... to find rows and rows of closed crates! Who knows where that accursed dagger is! Luckily, there appears to be a catalogue with the location of the items! You seek the dagger in the index and find it easily enough. Not so easy is to decode the directions to the right crate...

15F E9 E7 6F F1 64 20 F3 6E 20 74 68 E8 20 142 EA 66 74

levelsInfo.title: The Dagger!
levelsInfo.page: Easy, after all! You open the second crate on the left and inside, upon a velvet cushion, lies the Dagger of Banishment! Which you barely get a glimpse of before a cloud of dust bursts from the cushion and gets all over your face! You try not to breath it in, but no avail! You start to hallucinate...

levelsInfo.title: Looking for More
levelsInfo.page: Your mind clears. "Fire". You wonder... where did that come from? And why are you even alive? Surely that dust was some kind of trap for unwary thieves? Oh well, no time to waste, better move on while there is still an universe to save! Before departing, is there perhaps something else in the vault that could help you? You take a look around, trying to see things are they are, not as they appear to be. Not everything is as straightfoward as it appears, in this vault.

levelsInfo.title: Find the Crazies
levelsInfo.page: A Skull Amulet! According to the index, the Amulet of Bravery! A little bravery can't harm, so you put it on. Time to go find the crazy cultist and put an end to their plan! Surely they will be hidden somewhere. Where could that be? You remember a colorful image from the book you read in the library that may contain the answer to that question, if you just look at the right model of thing.

levelsInfo.title: Pick an Animal
levelsInfo.page: There you go! Skipping every other step leads you to the door! Now, how to open it? It is engraved with a number of sigils in the shape of animals. Maybe you need to press some? The wrong one probably won't be good for your health, though... In frustration, you bang your head against the wall! You start to see stars, but then you remember, amongst the haze: there was an animal on one of the books! Maybe that's it! You just need to bring everything together into focus...

levelsInfo.title: Facing Your Enemies!
levelsInfo.page:
You enter the room. Twelve chanting hooded figures, doning black robes and cowls that cover their faces stop changing. On a dais, in front of an altar, of of them some kind of high-priest, holds a dagger over a bowl of fire. With a dark voice he says: "Ah... We would be fetching you soon, but you saved us the trouble! Grab him!". At that, two of the other cultists walk towards you. Trapped! But, that voice... It sounds familiar, somehow! You try to look at the high-priest's face, but it is covered with some kind of colored gauze. You try to focus and see what you can through its holes... 

FXFIFF YORESR EMYETQ SOYRNR QAJPDG RAEOOX

levelsInfo.title: Summoning
levelsInfo.page:
"Professor Geoffrey?!", you ask, incredously. "Indeed, it is I! Since we met years ago I've been keeping an eye on you. I always check all my students for their aura and it appears that yours is unusually suited for this role! The planets are now alligned and the barriers between planes of existance weaker. It is time to bring the Old Destroyer back and put this wretch of a world out of its misery! Bring him forth!". You are pushed forward. High-Priest Geoffrey begins to chant anew. He draws his dagger and cuts you across the cheek. You blood falls on the fiery bowl. Reality stars to shimmer and coil over itself, as you hear the priest's incantation. The spell feels odd, twisted, and somehow much simpler that at first it would appear. 

in_adar
kas ota
tygam b
o it s_
 achedu
 r wort
 e klaa

levelsInfo.title: The Old Destroyer Comes Forth!
levelsInfo.page:
A hole of sorts starts to manifest. Unfathomable darkness lies beyond. No! Not all is darkness! Something is coming! A writhing mass of tentacles appears, looming larger. A huge (or is it small?) creature approaches! You can barely comprehend it with your mind. You know that without the help of the Amulet you found earlier you would now be irrecuperably mad! "Come, our master!", yells the priest! The creature responds, roaring its name! The name itself rends asunder the fabric of reality! The sound has meaning, beyond that of the sound itself!

roar.mid

levelsInfo.title: All Is Lost!
levelsInfo.page:
The creature is drawn to you! The high-priest and his accolites scream in joy! Its tentacles engulf you, as it draws near! The high-priest shrieks: "with your sacrifice, the summoning will be complete!". His eyes shine with madness. "Not so!", you yell, drawing the Dagger of Banishment. "Noo!!!!", screams the high-priest as you stab Cthulho in the forehead! It works! It contorns in pain as it recedes through the portal, that is visibly shrinking! The world is saved! You, not so much! The creature pulls you with it as it crawls back into its dark dimension. It lets go. You are stranded...

The portal is closing, but out of reach. You hear a voice in your head, though. "Be calm", it says. "I'll help you one last time. This is a realm where thought is king. Picture where you want to be, and you will be taken there!". You try to clear your mind and think of home...

levelsInfo.title: All Is Found!
levelsInfo.page:
A blinding flash of light... and you're back in Lisbon, right next to your house! It worked! You went through this ordeal, saved the world, and managed to retain a very special thing throughout, although sometimes it is not easy to find in the first place...

41.429633, 81.391303

levelsInfo.title: A Rich Person!
levelsInfo.page: Carefuly, and after some research, you make your way back to the house (if was Geoffrey's home!). The priests lie dead at the bottom of the stairs. The portal is closed, and all seems well. Better make sure: you torch the place! Not without before having carried out most of the priceless artifacts in the vault. Some you hide or keep for yourself. Many you sell. Congratulations! You are now rich beyond imagining (and have quite a few XP more too). We hope you had fun reaching the end of this year's Quest!
